citation.article-title: Virgibacillus alimentarius sp. nov., isolated from a traditional Korean food
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Virgibacillus alimentarius sp. nov.
Virgibacillus alimentarius (a.li.men.ta′ri.us. L. masc. adj. alimentarius pertaining to food).
Colonies are circular, convex, cream-coloured and 1.0–2.0 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days on MA.
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, motile rods (0.5×1.2 µm) which form chains.
Spores are formed in terminal or subterminal position.
Growth occurs at pH 7.0–11.0 (optimum, pH 10.0), at 4–40 °C (optimum, 37 °C) and with 0–30 % NaCl (optimum, 9–10 %).
Produces acetoin, but not ONPG, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, citrate, hydrogen sulphide, urease, tryptophan deaminase, indole or gelatinase.

Acid is produced from glycerol, d-ribose, d-adonitol, d-glucose, N-acetylglucosamine, aesculin, d-tagatose, potassium 2-ketogluconate and potassium 5-ketogluconate, but not from erythritol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, l-xylose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, inulin, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, turanose, d-lyxose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol or potassium gluconate.
The predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, iso-C17 : 1 and/or anteiso-C17 : 1, C16 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 1ω11c.
The polar lipids present are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and two unknown lipids.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 37.0 mol%.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is of the meso-diaminopimelic acid type.
The type strain, J18T ( = KACC 14624T = JCM 16994T), was isolated from a traditional salt-fermented seafood made from gizzard shad in Korea.
